p: Niche overlap between species in the environmental space was measured by the Schoener D metric (Schoener, 1970), and niche similarity tests were performed according to Warren, Glor, and Turelli ( 2008), using 100 randomizations in the null model. When the observed niche overlap value was significant ( p < 0.05) based on this two‐way test (similarity of species A vs. B and of species B vs. A), the climatic niches of both species were considered similar, indicating that one species predicts the climatic niche of the other better than would be expected by chance under a specific null model.
